item.description:
I meet with a local group that frequently paddles this river for excersize and its convient location to our work places.

You can join us if you want..
i get there a bit before 5 and we all hit the water around 5 to 5 30..

Sometimes we put in here and retrieve at the weslian boat launch bt the harbor restaurant and bar in middletown.....
a light would be a safety thing to have just in case.....

Notes:

GETTING THERE, from the north,
Look at your map first.. I really try to add all the turns and stuff but once in a while i have left out something.

get onto Rte 9 south, (to and in Cromwell) go to exit 19
Turn (right) off the exit, =west toward Kmart and Stop and Shop
At the first light you see (intersection of rte 372 and rte 3) take the left (south toward stop n shop) onto rte 3= shunpike rd
There is a KFC, MackDonalds, and a Drunkin Doonuts while heading to the next traffic light. Use Drunkin Donuts (driveway) there is an empty lot which is coned off but since there is construction going on , park down in the far back of the Drunken Donuts lot.
There is a water trail sign showing the most dangerous animals and what not to feed the animals...including the banjo boys...
I will have a spare kayak with me for anyone that wants to use it.

i found it after the last person became dinner for some wild animal..
No sining " Har... Paddling in a dead mans kayak, looking over my back, incase the gohst wants it back.."

The trip usually takes 2 hours or so but if we do some exploring ..then its over when its over provided you have not been eaten by wild creatures....

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: Tuesday Night Paddle on the Ookie Spookie River in Cromwell
